options.label: D
options.text: They were unknown to European scientists.

multiple-choice.question: Why did zoos begin breeding programs for the Takhi horse in the early 1900s?

options.label: A
options.text: To make money from ticket sales.

options.label: B
options.text: To rebrand as centers for conservation after the near extinction of the American bison and the passenger pigeon.

options.label: C
options.text: To acquire the previously unknown species.

options.label: D
options.text: To draw visitors with exotic animals.

multiple-choice.question: What was the basis for breeders' decisions on what a wild Takhi should look like?

options.label: A
options.text: A rigorous model based on just a few specimens and broad beliefs about what a primitive horse might look like.

options.label: B
options.text: A study of the horses' behavior in their native habitat.

options.label: D
options.text: A genetic analysis of the horses' DNA.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the complications of the Takhi horse reintroduction program?

options.label: A
options.text: The horses are not well adapted to their native habitat.

options.label: B
options.text: The horses are closely monitored and controlled for their own protection.

options.label: C
options.text: The horses are not different from the horses who were taken from those steppes a century earlier.

options.label: D
options.text: The horses are not being bred in zoos.

multiple-choice.question: What is the most direct cause of animal extinctions today?

options.label: C
options.text: The role of zoos in conservation.

title: The surprising secret to a healthier gut - Kathryn M. Stephenson and David L. Suskind

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the name of the Chinese alchemist who was renowned for his special soup that could cure diarrhea-stricken patients?
What is the name of the treatment that involves infusing a new batch of microorganisms into the intestine to reset the gut microbiome?
What is the main goal of fecal microbial transplantation in patients with antibiotic-resistant Clostridiodes difficile infection?

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce the symptoms of the infection

options.label: C
options.text: To reset the gut microbiome and displace the infectious invader

options.label: D
options.text: To prevent the infection from spreading

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary way that fecal microbial transplantation is administered to patients?

options.label: B
options.text: Through a tube into the stomach or colon

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the estimated effectiveness of fecal microbial transplantation in curing patients with antibiotic-resistant Clostridiodes difficile infection?
